citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no specific frequency or number of animals noted for
sampling dogs for intestinal parasites and heartworm. Not having how many dogs need to be sampled for heartworm or
fecal parasites documented in the program of veterinary care doesn't ensure that an adequate number of dogs are being
sampled. Intestinal parasites and heartworm are common causes of disease in dogs and, if undetected and not properly
treated, can lead to serious illness. All required information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of
veterinary care.
In addition, none of the adult dogs are currently up-to-date on their vaccines for distemper or parvo. Not vaccinating all
adults dogs doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from the various diseases. All adult dogs must be
vaccinated for distemper and parvo in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no specific frequency or number of animals noted for 
sampling dogs for intestinal parasites and heartworm. Not having how many dogs need to be sampled for heartworm or 
fecal parasites documented in the program of veterinary care doesn't ensure that an adequate number of dogs are being 
sampled. Intestinal parasites and heartworm are common causes of disease in dogs and, if undetected and not properly 
treated, can lead to serious illness. All required information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of 
veterinary care. 
 
In addition, none of the adult dogs are currently up-to-date on their vaccines for distemper or parvo. Not vaccinating all 
adults dogs doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from the various diseases. All adult dogs must be 
vaccinated for distemper and parvo in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.
